programme.title: World War II: Secrets From Above
programme.desc: A look at some of the extraordinary events of the Second World War from a brand-new perspective.

programme.title: World War II: Secrets From Above
programme.desc: In 1942, Hitler wants revenge for the relentless bombing of German cities; in a secret research facility, his scientists are developing the world's first cruise and ballistic missiles.

programme.title: World War II: Secrets From Above
programme.desc: In 1945, Stalin wages a war of annihilation against Nazi Germany; over one million Soviet soldiers charge towards Berlin; the Red Army must defeat several German strongholds in a series of battles.

programme.title: World War II: Secrets From Above
programme.desc: By 1943 Hitler's marauding armies have steamrollered across mainland Europe; the allies can't compete on the battlefield, so the commanders plan an audacious attack on the booming industry, which is producing German tanks, submarines and aircraft.

programme.title: World War II: Secrets From Above
programme.desc: December 1944 - Hitler launches an all-out assault on the Western front across Belgium and Luxembourg; vastly outnumbered allied platoons face off against entire German battalions in a series of David Vs Goliath attacks.

programme.title: World War II: Secrets From Above
programme.desc: In May 1940, 400,000 Allied troops are surrounded by Hitler's army on the beaches of Dunkirk; deep in the tunnels under Dover Castle, the Royal Navy plans a rescue mission; success or failure could decide the outcome of the war.

programme.title: World War 2 from Above
programme.desc: Reconstructing the WWII battle in the skies over Britain, the hunt for the deadly Nazi U-boats, the parachute drop at Arnhem, the Allies' bloody struggle through Normandy, the showdown at the Italian Abbey of Montecassino, and the fight for Poland.

programme.title: World War 2 from Above
programme.desc: The longest campaign of the war pits the deadly stealth of the Nazi U-boats against the code-breaking genius and long-range bombers of the Allies.

programme.title: World War 2 from Above
programme.desc: The Allies head into enemy territory after capturing the beaches of Northern France; they embark on a two-month march to liberate Paris.

programme.title: World War 2 from Above
programme.desc: September 1944: Thousands of troops drop from the skies over the Netherlands, as the Allies launch the largest airborne assault in history.

programme.title: Limitless With Chris Hemsworth
programme.desc: Chris has done everything possible to delay the aging process. Now he's facing his most extreme and emotional challenge. He's testing the theory that the best way to combat aging and fear of mortality might not be to fight it but accept it.

programme.title: Limitless With Chris Hemsworth
programme.desc: Psychologist Modupe Akinola challenges Chris to stay calm during a terrifying walk along a crane that's projecting from a skyscraper. Chris learns powerful techniques to control stress in his life and combat the risk it poses to long-term health.
